00046 class generator_t {
00047     public:
00048     typedef base_random_generator::result_type result_type;
00049     typedef boost::mt19937 default_random_t;
00050 
00051     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00052         generator_t() { mLock.lock(); init(); }
00053         ~generator_t() { mLock.unlock(); }
00054     #else
00055         generator_t() { init(); }
00056     #endif
00057 
00058     result_type operator()() { return mGeneratorObj->operator()(); }
00059 
00060     static void set_generator(base_random_generator *p) {
00061         #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00062             mLock.lock();
00063             mGeneratorObj.reset(p);
00064             mLock.unlock();
00065         #else
00066             mGeneratorObj.reset(p);
00067         #endif
00068     }
00069 
00070     private:
00071     void init() {
00072         if (mGeneratorObj.get() == 0) {
00073             typedef default_random_t T;
00074             T *genobj(new T(boost::uint32_t(time(0)+clock())));
00075             random_generator<T> *obj=new random_generator<T>(genobj);
00076             set_generator(obj);
00077         }
00078     }
00079 
00080     static std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> mGeneratorObj;
00081 
00082     #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00083         static boost::mutex mLock;
00084     #endif
00085 };
00086 
00087 std::auto_ptr<base_random_generator> generator_t::mGeneratorObj;
00088 
00089 #ifdef XINT_THREADSAFE
00090     boost::mutex generator_t::mLock;
00091 #endif
00092 
00093 } // namespace

00097 void set_random_generator(base_random_generator *obj) {
00098     generator_t::set_generator(obj);
00099 }

00101 unsigned int get_random() {
00102     generator_t gen;
00103     return gen();
00104 }

00109 // The secure random generator
00110 
00112 
00113 #ifdef _WIN32
00114     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00115         typedef BOOLEAN (WINAPI *RtlGenRandomFn)(PVOID, ULONG);
00116         typedef DWORD result_type;
00117 
00118         impl_t(): dll(0), fn(0) {
00119             // This should work under WinXP, Vista, and Win7. No guarantees about
00120             // future compatibility, but I doubt that Microsoft will get rid of it
00121             // (it's too useful), and I doubt that they'll change it now that it's
00122             // well-known (it would break too many programs). We could also use the
00123             // rand_s function in more recent versions of Visual C++, but that
00124             // causes compatibility problems with older versions of Windows.
00125             dll=LoadLibraryA("Advapi32.dll");
00126             if (dll != 0) fn=RtlGenRandomFn(GetProcAddress(dll, "SystemFunction036"));
00127             if (fn == 0) {
00128                 destroy();
00129                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00130             }
00131         }
00132 
00133         ~impl_t() { destroy(); }
00134 
00135         result_type operator()() {
00136             result_type r=0;
00137             if (!fn(&r, sizeof(result_type)))
00138                 throw exceptions::no_strong_random("RtlGenRandom failed");
00139             return r;
00140         }
00141 
00142         void destroy() { if (dll) FreeLibrary(dll); }
00143 
00144         HMODULE dll;
00145         RtlGenRandomFn fn;
00146     };
00147 
00148     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 32; }
00149 #else
00150     struct strong_random_generator::impl_t {
00151         typedef unsigned char result_type;
00152 
00153         impl_t(): rng("/dev/urandom", std::ios::binary) {
00154             // This should be supported under most non-Windows systems. Note
00155             // that we're using /dev/urandom, not /dev/random -- /dev/random is
00156             // more secure, but it can be VERY slow.
00157             if (!rng) throw exceptions::no_strong_random();
00158         }
00159 
00160         result_type operator()() {
00161             int r=rng.get();
00162             if (r==EOF) throw exceptions::no_strong_random("/dev/urandom "
00163                 "returned EOF");
00164             return static_cast<result_type>(r);
00165         }
00166 
00167         std::ifstream rng;
00168     };
00169 
00170     double strong_random_generator::entropy() const { return 8; }
00171 #endif
00172

00175 const bool strong_random_generator::has_fixed_range = true;
00176 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min_value =
00177     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::min)();
00178 const strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max_value =
00179     (std::numeric_limits<impl_t::result_type>::max)();
00180 strong_random_generator::strong_random_generator(): impl(new impl_t) { }
00181 strong_random_generator::~strong_random_generator() { delete impl; }
00182 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::operator()() {
00183     return (*impl)(); }

00186 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::min
00187     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return min_value; }
00188 strong_random_generator::result_type strong_random_generator::max
00189     BOOST_PREVENT_MACRO_SUBSTITUTION () const { return max_value; }

00193 // Returns a positive (unless told otherwise) integer between zero and
00194 // (1<<bits)-1, inclusive
00195 
00218 integer random_by_size(size_t bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool
00219     can_be_negative)
00220 {
00221     if (bits<=0) return integer::zero();
00222 
00223     // Grab a bunch of bits
00224     generator_t randomGenerator;
00225     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00226     while (bitqueue.size() < bits) bitqueue.push(randomGenerator(),
00227         std::numeric_limits<generator_t::result_type>::digits);
00228 
00229     // Stick them into an integer
00230     integer p;
00231     p._realloc((bits + bits_per_digit - 1) / bits_per_digit);
00232     digit_t *pp = p._get_writable_digits(), *ppe = pp + p._get_length();
00233     while (pp < ppe) *pp++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00234 
00235     // Trim it to the proper length
00236     size_t index=(bits/bits_per_digit);
00237     digit_t mask=(digit_t(1) << (bits % bits_per_digit))-1;
00238     if (mask==0) { mask=digit_mask; --index; }
00239     p._get_writable_digits()[index] &= mask;
00240     for (digit_t *i=p._get_writable_digits()+index+1,
00241         *ie=p._get_writable_digits()+p._get_length(); i<ie; ++i) *i=0;
00242     p._cleanup();
00243 
00244     if (high_bit_on) setbit(p, bits-1);
00245     if (low_bit_on) setbit(p, 0);
00246     if (can_be_negative) p._set_negative(randomGenerator() & 0x01);
00247 
00248     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(p);
00249 }
